ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes. It is the product of an eclectic and well constructed syllabus and an engaged and knowledgeable professor.
An excellent seminar to take. An excellent opportunity for self reflection and creative writing.
Yes, especially if it was a student who was interested in close reading of literature. (Maybe less for historians.)

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Of course, I had thought about how my story, our stories, inform our work but I hadn't engaged this idea with the kind of rigor the course provided. I feel better equipped to apply the autobiographical in my work as a writer and teacher.

It gave an excellent opportunity for self reflection and meditating in what is at stake in writing of any sort. Especially thinking about the fact that all writing even literary criticism is very useful and true. I more at ease with this fact because of Professor Stepto's class.
Gave me the tools to do analysis of autobiography genre, which I didn't realize but does involve methods and ways of thinking that are not part of reading regular ol' fiction
